article:
{{Interventions infobox | Name = | Image = | Caption = | ICD10 = | ICD9 = |
MeshID = | OPS301 = | OtherCodes = | HCPCSlevel2 = }} 'Transrectal biopsy' is a
biopsy procedure in which a sample of tissue is removed from the prostate using
a thin needle that is inserted through the rectum and into the prostate.
Transrectal ultrasound (TRUS) is usually used to guide the needle. The sample is
examined under a microscope to see if it contains cancer.
